questions.question: What is the best overall description of 'Focused Office Work'?
choices: A calm indoor meeting with formal presentations
People in a public setting engaged in an everyday activity
A private ceremony with an audience and a stage
A laboratory experiment with specialized equipment
questions.explanation: The scene title and context point to a public setting and routine activity rather than a formal ceremony, lab, or meeting.

questions.question: Which phrase is best for avoiding an unsupported guess?
questions.explanation: 'It appears that' is a hedging phrase that keeps your description evidence-based.

questions.question: Which connector best signals a contrast between two ideas?

speakingTasks.prompt: Describe the scene in 'Focused Office Work'. What do you notice first?
Explain how the setting in 'Focused Office Work' affects the mood of the people.
Predict what might happen next in 'Focused Office Work' and give one reason.

writingTasks.prompt: Write a short description of the photo and summarize the main mood in 'Focused Office Work'.
Explain the relationship between the people and the setting in 'Focused Office Work'. Use at least two specific details.
writingTasks.sampleAnswer: In 'Focused Office Work', the setting provides clear context for the people’s actions. Overall, the scene feels purposeful because the subjects seem engaged and oriented toward a shared goal. For example, their body language suggests focus, and the environment appears to support that activity. As a result, the mood is more organized than casual, which indicates that the moment is part of a routine rather than a spontaneous event.

writingTasks.prompt: Some people prefer busy environments, while others prefer quiet ones. Using 'Focused Office Work' as inspiration, state your preference and support it with reasons.
writingTasks.sampleAnswer: I prefer quieter environments because they help me think clearly and work efficiently. In contrast, busy places can be distracting and make it harder to focus. For example, when I study in a calm space, I can organize my ideas and finish tasks faster. A possible explanation is that fewer interruptions reduce mental fatigue. Overall, choosing a quiet environment leads to better concentration and less stress, which improves my performance.

examTips: Start with a one-sentence overview before details.
Use location phrases (foreground/background) to organize your description.
Avoid guessing; hedge with 'it appears' or 'it is likely'.
Include 2–3 specific details (objects, actions, setting) to support ideas.
Use linking words (overall, in contrast, as a result) for coherence.
Speak steadily and manage time: plan 5 seconds, speak 40–45 seconds.

descriptions.beginner: A couple sits on a rock at sunrise, looking over a mountain lake and valley. It takes place in an office or workspace with a desk and computer. Use simple sentences to describe people, actions, and objects.
descriptions.intermediate: A couple sits on a rock at sunrise, looking over a mountain lake and valley. Setting: an office or workspace with a desk and computer. Atmosphere: focused, serious, productive, quiet. This lesson builds both everyday and academic language for describing the photo clearly, making inferences, and organizing ideas for TOEFL tasks.
descriptions.advanced: A couple sits on a rock at sunrise, looking over a mountain lake and valley. The setting suggests: an office or workspace with a desk and computer. Overall tone: focused, serious, productive, quiet. A strong response highlights concrete visual evidence, then adds cautious inference (what is likely happening and why) without over-claiming. You will build academic vocabulary and structured answers for TOEFL-style speaking, writing tasks.
descriptions.simple: A couple sits on a rock at sunrise, looking over a mountain lake and valley. It takes place in an office or workspace with a desk and computer. Use simple sentences to describe people, actions, and objects.

sceneNotes: Focus on what you can SEE (people, setting, actions).
- Simple: Mostly Present Continuous (am/is/are + V-ing) + basic 'There is/There are' for objects.
- Intermediate: Adds prepositional phrases (at/on/near), quantifiers (several/a few/a lot of), and 1 relative clause (who/that/where).
- Advanced: Adds inference language (probably/likely/might), contrast/linkers (while/whereas/in addition), and optional passive voice when relevant.
Add 1–2 inferences (why they are there, how they feel).
Use at least 2 collocations in your speaking/writing.

grammar.title: Present Continuous (حال استمراری)
grammar.rule: برای توصیف کاری که **همین الان** در تصویر اتفاق می‌افتد از **am/is/are + V‑ing** استفاده کن.

grammar.title: Passive Voice (ساخت مجهول)
grammar.rule: وقتی «خودِ عمل» مهم‌تر از انجام‌دهنده است از **be + V3** استفاده کن.

examples.en: Mountain lake is seen in the foreground.

grammar.title: Linking Words (کلمات ربط)
grammar.rule: برای وصل‌کردن ایده‌ها از **because / although / while / so** استفاده کن.

examples.en: Although the trail is steep, they keep going.

proDescriptions.label: Academic Description
proDescriptions.text: The image portrays a couple on a rock overlooking a lake and snowy mountains, the man has his arm around the woman. Visual elements such as lighting, posture, and setting provide contextual cues that support an interpretation of mood and purpose. The composition balances foreground action with background environment to communicate a clear everyday scenario.

proDescriptions.text: The moment feels frozen in time: A couple sits on a rock facing a lake and distant snowy mountains. Small details—light, movement, and expressions—turn an ordinary scene into a memorable snapshot.

scenarios.title: A memory
scenarios.en: Last weekend, I found myself in Mountain overlook above a lake. A couple sits on a rock, wrapped in warm clothes, watching light over a lake and snowy mountains. At first, I noticed Mountain lake, Rock ledge, Sunrise sky and the way people were sitting close together. Then I looked closer: their clothing (Man: green jacket, Woman: yellow hoodie/jacket) and their expressions made the scene feel romantic, peaceful, comforted. After that, something small happened that changed the mood, and we had to respond quickly. In the end, we solved it, and the moment became a story I still remember.
scenarios.fa: آخرِ هفته‌ی قبل Mountain overlook above a lake بودم. A couple sits on a rock, wrapped in warm clothes, watching light over a lake and snowy mountains. اول Mountain lake، Rock ledge و Sunrise sky را دیدم و اینکه آدم‌ها چطور Sitting close together. بعد دقیق‌تر نگاه کردم: لباس‌ها (Man: green jacket و Woman: yellow hoodie/jacket) و حالت چهره‌ها باعث شد فضا Romantic، Peaceful و Comforted به نظر برسد. بعدش یک اتفاق کوچک افتاد که حال‌وهوا را عوض کرد و مجبور شدیم سریع واکنش نشان بدهیم. آخرش حلش کردیم و همان لحظه تبدیل شد به خاطره‌ای که هنوز یادم می‌ماند.

grammarUsed.en: Past simple with time marker (last weekend) and sequencing (at first/then/after that/in the end).
grammarUsed.fa: گذشته ساده با قید زمان و ترتیب رخدادها (اول/بعد/بعدش/آخرش).

en.tense: Past Simple (V2) to tell a short memory, plus sequencing words (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: Time markers: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago.
howToBuild: Start with a time phrase: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
Change the main action into past simple (reviewed, chose, played…).
Use sequencing words to make a clear story: first, then, after that, finally.
End with a result or feeling: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: Yesterday, the couple sat close together.
Then, the couple checked Mountain lake and continued.
Finally, they felt Romantic about the outcome.

fa.tense: گذشته ساده (Past Simple) برای تعریف یک خاطره کوتاه، همراه با کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: عبارات زمانی: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago
howToBuild: با یک عبارت زمانی شروع کن: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
فعل اصلی را به گذشته ساده تبدیل کن (reviewed, chose, played…).
از کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده استفاده کن: first, then, after that, finally.
با نتیجه یا حس تمام کن: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: دیروز، The couple sat close together.
بعد، The couple Mountain lake را بررسی کرد و ادامه داد.
در نهایت، آن‌ها درباره نتیجه Romantic بودند.

scenarios.title: Reflection
scenarios.en: Over the past few months, I have started paying attention to scenes like this. I have noticed that details such as Mountain lake, Rock ledge, Sunrise sky are not background; they guide the story. I have also learned how actions like watching sunrise and scenery can signal feelings such as romantic, peaceful, comforted. Since then, I have taken more time to observe before I speak, and my descriptions have become clearer and more specific.
scenarios.fa: در چند ماه گذشته شروع کرده‌ام به صحنه‌هایی مثل این بیشتر دقت کنم. متوجه شده‌ام جزئیاتی مثل Mountain lake، Rock ledge و Sunrise sky فقط «پس‌زمینه» نیستند؛ آن‌ها مسیر داستان را تعیین می‌کنند. همچنین یاد گرفته‌ام کارهایی مثل Watching sunrise and scenery چطور می‌تواند احساساتی مثل Romantic، Peaceful و Comforted را نشان بدهد. از آن زمان بیشتر قبل از حرف زدن مشاهده می‌کنم و توصیف‌هایم واضح‌تر و دقیق‌تر شده است.

grammarUsed.en: Present perfect to connect past learning to the present, plus since/over the past to frame experience.
grammarUsed.fa: حال کامل برای وصل کردن یادگیری گذشته به حال، همراه با «در چند ماه گذشته/از آن زمان».

en.tense: Present Perfect (have/has + past participle) to connect past experience to the present; use since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: Say what has happened up to now (experience/result).
Use since (a starting point) or for (a duration).
Add a contrast or reflection: however, although, even though.
Finish with what they are doing now (present continuous) if needed.
examples: The couple has already handled similar situations before.
The couple has learned to stay Romantic in Mountain overlook above a lake.
Although it looks routine, the details have mattered.

fa.tense: حال کامل (have/has + شکل سوم فعل) برای ربط دادن گذشته به حال؛ همراه با since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: بگو تا همین الآن چه تجربه/نتیجه‌ای اتفاق افتاده.
از since (نقطه شروع) یا for (مدت زمان) استفاده کن.
یک جمله‌ی بازتاب/تضاد اضافه کن: however, although, even though.
اگر لازم شد با یک جمله حال استمراری وضعیت الآن را بگو.
examples: The couple قبلاً موقعیت‌های مشابهی را تجربه کرده است.
The couple یاد گرفته است در Mountain overlook above a lake Romantic بماند.
اگرچه کار روتین به نظر می‌رسد، جزئیات مهم بوده‌اند.

scenarios.title: A challenge
scenarios.en: If we were to replay this moment in Mountain overlook above a lake, one small change could create a big problem. If Mountain lake, Rock ledge had been missing or damaged, we would have had to improvise. Someone might have said, “We should slow down and check,” and another person could have replied that we were running out of time. In a situation like this, we should prioritize safety and clarity, even if it means changing the plan. If I had ignored those details, I might have misunderstood the whole scene.
scenarios.fa: اگر قرار بود این لحظه در Mountain overlook above a lake دوباره تکرار شود، یک تغییر کوچک می‌توانست یک مشکل بزرگ بسازد. اگر Mountain lake و Rock ledge نبود یا آسیب دیده بود، مجبور می‌شدیم بداهه تصمیم بگیریم. ممکن بود کسی بگوید «باید آهسته‌تر برویم و بررسی کنیم» و نفر دیگری جواب بدهد که وقت کم داریم. در چنین موقعیتی بهتر است ایمنی و شفافیت را در اولویت بگذاریم، حتی اگر مجبور شویم برنامه را تغییر بدهیم. اگر آن جزئیات را نادیده می‌گرفتم، شاید کل صحنه را اشتباه می‌فهمیدم.

grammarUsed.en: Conditionals for hypotheticals, modals for advice/possibility, and short reported speech (might have said/could have replied).
grammarUsed.fa: شرطی‌ها برای موقعیت فرضی، افعال کمکی برای امکان/پیشنهاد، و نقل‌قول غیرمستقیم برای بازگویی گفت‌وگو.

en.tense: Mixed grammar for higher-level storytelling: conditionals, modals (might/must), and reported speech.
sentenceStructure: Second conditional: If + past simple, would + base verb.
Third conditional: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
Modals of deduction: might/must/can't + base verb.
Reported speech: He said (that) … / She asked if …
howToBuild: Describe the challenge and add a hypothetical solution (If…, would…).
Use modals to infer causes from the photo (They might…, It must…).
Add reported speech for realism: Someone said that…
Finish with a consequence or lesson learned.
examples: If the couple had checked Mountain lake earlier, they would have avoided a mistake.
They might be under pressure, but they must stay Romantic.
The supervisor said that every detail mattered.

fa.tense: گرامر ترکیبی سطح بالا: شرطی‌ها، افعال کمکی (might/must) و نقل قول غیرمستقیم (reported speech).
sentenceStructure: شرطی نوع دوم: If + past simple, would + فعل ساده.
شرطی نوع سوم: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
نقل قول غیرمستقیم: He said (that)… / She asked if…
howToBuild: چالش را بگو و یک راه‌حل فرضی اضافه کن (If…, would…).
با مدال‌ها درباره علت‌ها حدس بزن (might/must).
برای واقعی‌تر شدن از reported speech استفاده کن.
در پایان نتیجه یا درسِ داستان را بگو.
examples: اگر The couple زودتر Mountain lake را چک کرده بود، اشتباه را جلوگیری می‌کرد.
ممکن است تحت فشار باشند، اما باید Romantic بمانند.
سرپرست گفت که هر جزئیاتی مهم است.
